Framework.Description: Scrum is a specific Agile framework designed to facilitate the development and delivery of high-quality products.
Features: It provides a set of roles, events, and artifacts to structure and guide the work of a development team.

Roles.Description: Scrum defines specific roles, including Product Owner, Scrum Master, and Development Team.

RolesDetails.ProductOwner: The Product Owner represents the stakeholders.
RolesDetails.ScrumMaster: The Scrum Master facilitates the process.
RolesDetails.DevelopmentTeam: The Development Team consists of professionals doing the work.

Events.Description: Scrum introduces events such as Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective to organize and coordinate the work.

SprintsDetails.ProductIncrement: A potentially shippable product increment is delivered at the end of each sprint.

Artifacts.Description: Scrum defines artifacts like the Product Backlog, Sprint Backlog, and Increment to manage and visualize the work.

ArtifactsDetails.ProductBacklog: The Product Backlog is a prioritized list of features.
ArtifactsDetails.SprintBacklog: The Sprint Backlog is a subset selected for the sprint.
ArtifactsDetails.Increment: The Increment is the product functionality delivered at the end of each sprint.
